com.paydiant.android.ui.service.captureToken

Interface ICameraEventListener


  • public interface ICameraEventListener
    A listener providing the support for receiving callbacks during certain camera events like camera open, start preview, stop preview, release etc..
    Since:
    4.4.0.3
    Author:
    Paydiant
    See Also:
    ITokenManagementService.setCameraEventListener(ICameraEventListener)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CAMERA_OPEN_EVENT
      Event indicating the camera was opened.
      static int CAMERA_RELEASE_EVENT
      Event indicating the camera was released.
      static int CAMERA_START_PREVIEW_EVENT
      Event indicating the camera started capturing and drawing preview frames.
      static int CAMERA_STOP_PREVIEW_EVENT
      Event indicating the camera stopped previewing.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onCameraEvent(int cameraEvent, Camera camera)
      Gets called when a camera related event occurs.

    • Field Detail

      • CAMERA_STOP_PREVIEW_EVENT

        static final int CAMERA_STOP_PREVIEW_EVENT
        Event indicating the camera stopped previewing.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • onCameraEvent

        void onCameraEvent(int cameraEvent,
                 Camera camera)
        Gets called when a camera related event occurs. The provided camera parameter can be used override some of the configurations/parameters which are already set through the TokenManagementService and CameraManager, but providing conflicting parameters may cause the service to be unstable.
        Parameters:
        cameraEvent - Event that the callback was called upon. This can be one of;
        • CAMERA_OPEN_EVENT
        • CAMERA_RELEASE_EVENT
        • CAMERA_START_PREVIEW_EVENT
        • CAMERA_STOP_PREVIEW_EVENT
        camera - Camera instance that was using during the event.
        See Also:
        ITokenManagementService.setCameraEventListener(ICameraEventListener)
